CatDescriptText: Mrs. Dorothy Fowler, elevator operator, 645 Chalfont Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 8, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Which of these sources of leadership do you believe Negroes generally follow: church, labor, or politics? Why?" answer reads: "In my opinion, I think that they follow labor.  Most of the jobs are governed by the unions and therefore they follow where the source of their money."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Dorothy Fowler holding eyeglasses and newspaper, standing on corner of Fifth and Liberty Avenues, with May Building with Thrift Drugs in background, Downtown
